Saffron extract has shown detoxifying effects on alcohol-induced renal damage mostly through the inhibition of pro-apoptotic mediators including caspase enzymes and Bax/Bcl-2 signaling, as well as pro-inflammatory cytokines production ( Rezaee-Khorasany et al., 2019). Crocin has demonstrated nephroprotective properties in an animal model of diabetes-induced nephrotoxicity (
Table 2 ). Aside from general antioxidant properties ( Erdemli et al., 2017), this compound could decrease hyperurocemia via the inhibition of xanthine oxidase ( Altinoz et al., 2015). Moreover, a clinical trial using 100 mg/day of saffron in healthy subjects showed this plant to have a short-term immunopotentiation, considering the altered levels of immunoglobulins and the leukocytes count ( Kianbakht and Ghazavi, 2011).
